question.title: Synchronizing three steps in three different threads?

node.contents: use the codes under synchronize block for reference: http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java-concurrency/synchronized.html

astNode.text: use the codes under synchronize block for reference: http://tutorials.jenkov.com/java-concurrency/synchronized.html

node.contents: In my main programme, i start three threads as described below

astNode.text: In my main programme, i start three threads as described below

node.contents: I want Thread 1, 2 and 3 proceed for their next step only when all of them complete their first step.

astNode.text: I want Thread 1, 2 and 3 proceed for their next step only when all of them complete their first step.

node.contents: For example:- Thread 2 and Thread 3 have completed their first steps i.e 2A and 3A respectively but Thread1 did not complete step 1A. So thread 2 and 3 will wait till thread 1 complete step 1A

astNode.text: For example:- Thread 2 and Thread 3 have completed their first steps i.e 2A and 3A respectively but Thread1 did not complete step 1A. So thread 2 and 3 will wait till thread 1 complete step 1A

node.contents: I know i can handle it with simple static counter and only proceed once counter value is 3. But i am sure there must be something off the shelve available in thread/java.util.concurrent package?

astNode.text: I know i can handle it with simple static counter and only proceed once counter value is 3. But i am sure there must be something off the shelve available in thread/java.util.concurrent package?

node.contents: Please mark the answer correct when it works.

astNode.text: Please mark the answer correct when it works.

node.contents: Use a java.util.concurrent.CyclicBarrier. For example, create a CyclicBarrier with a count of 3:

astNode.text: Use a java.util.concurrent.CyclicBarrier. For example, create a CyclicBarrier with a count of 3:

elements.contents: CyclicBarrier cb = new CyclicBarrier(3); new Thread(new Thread1(cb)).start(); new Thread(new Thread2(cb)).start(); new Thread(new Thread3(cb)).start(); class Thread1 implements Runnable() { private CyclicBarrier barrier; public Thread1(CyclicBarrier cb) { barrier = cb; } public void run() { // execute 1A barrier.await(); // execute 1B } class Thread2 implements Runnable() { private CyclicBarrier barrier; public Thread2(CyclicBarrier cb) { barrier = cb; } public void run() { // execute 2A barrier.await(); // execute 2B } // repeat for Thread3

comments.text: // execute 1A barrier.await(); // execute 1B } class Thread2 implements Runnable() { private CyclicBarrier barrier; public Thread2(CyclicBarrier cb) { barrier = cb; } public void run() { // execute 2A barrier.await(); // execute 2B } // repeat for Thread3

node.contents: Each thread will execute until it reach the await() call, then it will stop until all 3 threads have reached that rendezvous point. When the third thread reaches that point (whichever one it is), the two that were waiting will proceed.

astNode.text: Each thread will execute until it reach the await() call, then it will stop until all 3 threads have reached that rendezvous point. When the third thread reaches that point (whichever one it is), the two that were waiting will proceed.
